website_summaries.verdict: A compact, fun "travel" TV with built-in speakers and a nice price.
pros: Includes rechargeable battery and digital tuner
Many owners say they get good reception
cons: Some complaints that the antenna is under-powered
Instructions that come with it are confusing and lack details

customer_reviews.title: Must plug in to watch more than a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Can watch for only a few minutes without plugging in, therefore wouldn't be of use if power goes out. Plugged in, it is wonderful and picks up most of the over the air channels. Picture is sharp. Have to move antenna sometimes to get undistorted reception like anything else with an antenna. Love the tv, just disappointed that it doesn't stay on for long unless it's plugged in - this eventually also happened to another portable tv I owned,similar design different brand/compay.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K8Z6IG2/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0
customer_reviews.text: Gets good reception when connected to my household antenna, will pick up a strong station 30 miles away with the antenna provided in the box. Chances are you will need an antenna upgrade. The sound is only loud enough for very near listening. say within 6 feet. Having said that, this makes a nice personal portable TV. Nice that it plays from a usb stick, but it would really be nice if it had an HDMI input in place of one of the AV inputs. It has a remote but being only a 7" screen I sit so close I dont use it.
customer_reviews.author: The Hoosier Poet

customer_reviews.title: This little TV is great. When we went through a hurricane and lost ...
customer_reviews.text: This little TV is great. When we went through a hurricane and lost power, I had this all charged up and ready to go. Hooked up a external antenna, and picked up over 60 channels. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Live saver during Irma
customer_reviews.text: Great TV working all throughout hurricane Irma. It was my only source of light as power went out at midnight, kept working on battery power all night so I was updated on the track of storm. Now I have hooked up to battery pack the 12 volt cord means I am using less power. Been going all day good picture and sounds. I have it attached to another antenna with the included attaching extension. Remote is wonderful the best purchase I made post Matthew last year in preparation for this year's storm season. I am planning to buy one for my Mom; everyone should have this TV for emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my AXESS TV
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my AXESS TV. The picture is sharp and clear. The color is great and the sound very crisp. The 9 inch screen is very easy to watch and fits very nicely in the corner of my cube at work. I get quite a few channels, and so far the antenna seems perfectly adequate. I could not get the TV stand set up as the instruction were not very good and I finally concluded I must be missing a part, but it's fine leaning against a coffee mug. I would highly recommend this little TV. Hopefully it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT LITTLE T
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT LITTLE T,V. I PURCHASED IT SO I WOULD HAVE ONE DURING A STORM. THE BATTERY LAST ONLY 1 HOUR SO I HAVE A CAR BATTERY TO PROVIDE LONGER TIME. I RECEIVE ABOUT 40 T.V. CHANNELS HERE IN THE MIAMI AREA. GOOD SOUND AND GOOD IMAGE. IT WAS ALL AND MORE I HAD HOPED- FOR. THE ONE STAR OFF WAS ONLY FOR THE BATTERY LIFE.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dickerman

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tv
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tv! The built in charger doesn't last long, mabey an hour or so until you have to plug it back in to the wall. Good for home, wouldn't recommend for backpacking...... UPDATE! ... I bought this little tv in 2016 and it is still running strong along with the remote. I haven't had to change the battery in the remote yet. I just bought another 1 as a backup in case my other one breaks but like i said still running strong even after a couple falls to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: ... had it for 2 days but so far it's pretty good, definitely had to get another antenna because ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for 2 days but so far it's pretty good, definitely had to get another antenna because the two that they sent with it didn't get anything but the Mexican channels here in San Diego, but the picture is good and it was worth the money if it lasts for a while..
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Pinkman

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable tv
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv for my husband as he drives a commercial truck and is sitting at sites most of the day. He loves it. It receives a good amount of channels using the air waves, and they are pretty clear for the most part. I also purchased an additional digital antenna so I'm not sure if that makes the reception better. The screen is a nice size and the colors are clear. The hubby is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tik27

customer_reviews.title: It's a better setup, better picture
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most purchasers, I wanted to use this TV strictly for the SD Card Slot. I have a daughter with Down Syndrome and Autism. She loves certain TV shows that I can get from YouTube then convert them into MPEG. Unlike the RCA, that I bought previously, the Axcess 7-inch has performed flawlessly. It's a better setup, better picture, and with a Car Charger. There's no comparison in my opinion. A 16 gig SD can hold a lot of shows.. A LOT more than a DVD and a lot more convenient. BTW, the reception with the screw-in antenna is GREAT compared to RCA's. Not to mention it's about $15 cheaper! I'm VERY happy with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Very clear picture and good sound.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 7 inch lcd tv. Once I set the tv up. The tv scanned over 30 channels. The picture is very clear and the sound is also clear. The tv came right on and I was able to go through the set up. After the tv scanned the tv shows came right on! You don't even need cable!! Set up was easy! All of the channels are very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Flower

customer_reviews.title: Nice & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the stand & sturdiness of this TV. I also love the USB & card slots! The last 7" TV I bought had a kickstand on back of it. This stand reminds me of my camera tripod.. It has knobs allowing movability up & down as well as tilting backward & forward. The included extra antenna is not very sturdy, but is strong. I will need to attach antenna to a sturdier base, but overall I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Rolfe

customer_reviews.title: Good for TV installers
customer_reviews.text: I install satellite tv and there are always customers who want a receiver set up where they don't have a tv yet. This allows me to set them up without taking a TV from another room or to troubleshoot the customer's TV to see where the problem is. It'd be nice if it had and HDMI port but... It has to be switched off to charge the battery. It's not possible to screw on a coaxial cable connector so I think you'd either have to modify the connector to have a longer stinger or the cut the plastic around the male connection on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scott

customer_reviews.title: MY GO TO AT BEDTIME
customer_reviews.text: MY GO TO AT BEDTIME; my partner never wanted a tv set in the bedroom; sez the bedroom is for sleeping...i need a little ION CHANNEL before knocking out so...great 9inch screen...simple to set up and use...altho i did sub the antenna for a better one (August DTA240 High Gain Digital TV Aerial - Portable Indoor/Outdoor Digital Antenna for USB TV Tuner / ATSC Television / DAB Radio - With Magnetic Bas). love the portability...lightweight n handy... UPDATE: Four years later...She gets the house, i keep the T.V. lol i keep it in the kitchen now...still works great! be well.
customer_reviews.author: cdchase

customer_reviews.title: It Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I no longer own a tv so when I decided that I wanted to convert my massive collection of VHS tapes to DVD, I needed a way to program the player/burner from a screen. After trying several cable configurations to my computer, I gave up and ordered this. It still takes a set of two cables to convert from the 3 plugs on the player to the one jack on the TV, but it works great. And my guests can play DVDs or VHS tapes when they visit and watch on this nice sized screen.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Loegering

customer_reviews.title: Very nice television.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice television. The picture is clear and the sound is good. My only issue is it's difficult to get a decent signal but that has nothing to do with the television itself. I would definitely recommend this television to anyone looking for something small and portable.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.S

customer_reviews.title: A good TV for camping and other activities where you otherwise ...
customer_reviews.text: A good TV for camping and other activities where you otherwise would have no screen. Good selection of inputs and the signal screen was adequate for me, but i used with it: If you need such a screen that is portable this is more than adequate!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanmarc Sookhoo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. If you are using inverted power then-so far-it ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. If you are using inverted power then-so far-it has not blown up the 12v input. If you are going to hook this into a HDTV antenna then you need to do some homework as both the TV and the antenna need to accept inverted power. I burned up several antennas until I got the right one. The solar array can power both the TV and the antenna without a problem. Also, I got a small padded hard case for the TV and a vinyl one for the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Just the Facts.

customer_reviews.title: FILLS THE BILL
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small TV for monitoring video recording. Two small 5" receivers that I bought 20+ years did not have the cable connections necessary. Thanks to the distributor forwarding an instruction sheet for this device, I found that this model would meet my needs and I bought it. As far as watching over-the-air programs, digital broadcasting is not as easily received as the older analog broadcasts, This model did however, do better than a digital receiver I bought several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Randall F.

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT
customer_reviews.text: WELL, I MAYBE DON'T "LOVE" IT BUT I LIKE IT - GET SEVERAL CHANNELS BUT OF COURSE COMCAST CAME IN WITHIN MINUTES OF HOOKING UP TO CABLE FOR ME TO PURCHASE A "BOX" - NAY, NAY SAYS I - I HAVE ALREADY FOUR BOXES - I JUST WANTED THIS FOR THE PATIO AND NOW IT'S A BIG MAGILLA - THOUGHT GOVT HAD STOPPED CABLE COMPANIES FROM INSISTING ON CONVERTER BOXES - GUESS NOT
customer_reviews.author: katydids

customer_reviews.title: TV
customer_reviews.text: Great little TV. Good price. Comes with 3 antenna options. If you connect to cable, you can get every station, if not, you will get about 10 stations. I brought this for myself so when I'm walking on the tread mill, time goes by fast.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Mangiante

customer_reviews.title: Great little TV for the money...
customer_reviews.text: With the proper amplified antenna this TV works very well. Even though I am in a city of 300,000 the dtv/atv signals are 26-50 miles away. The standard antennas in the box only picked up one channel. The amplified antenna picked up 15 which is a joy when needing to watch some sports on locals that are not available on ABC, CBS or Fox online due to blackout rules. Overall the little portable has a great picture decent sound and plenty of axillary inputs for photos and videos on USB or memory card. Car charger and RCA hookup is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dennis

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING LITTLE TV
customer_reviews.text: What a great little item. The multiple inputs for this are way beyond what you would expect. We downloaded a few movies to a thumb drive and play them with no problem. The antenna picks up plenty of local over the air channels. We bought it primarily to use if the power goes out in storms and the battery lasts close to 2 hours every time. Fantastic item for the price. Great picture quality and the viewing angle is also great. We couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Blanc Dan

customer_reviews.title: This little tv is great. I got it to use while travelling with ...
customer_reviews.text: This little tv is great. I got it to use while travelling with my trailer and I wasn't aware of the USB input until I wanted to use it. It plays video from the USB stick beautifully! I have the first three seasons of a show on an 8 gig stick to watch, so I don't have to rely on broadcast tv. I haven't used the regular tv yet, but I assume it will work as well as the USB input.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nolan

customer_reviews.title: it offers a GREAT Picture and can play other media from a USB
customer_reviews.text: With the right antenna, I bought two others under $10, it offers a GREAT Picture and can play other media from a USB. The stand offers some good options for placement and tilting. The remote is basic but works well. The size is good for about 10 feet away, but usually people hold it or have it near where they are sitting. You will enjoy this TV for the price! I like it. Has been reliable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Chris

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is very good. The tuner is not as sensitive as those ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot of included accessories make this small DTV very versatile. Can be used in a wide variety of situations. Picture quality is very good. The tuner is not as sensitive as those on higher priced and larger sized DTVs and using the supplied external antenna is a must to receive any OTA signals. But overall I'm pleased with this little TV. The Axess has an adapter that will allow you to attach other antennas, such as the Mohu Leaf, to it. Wish it had a protective carry pouch.
customer_reviews.author: KCCF46

customer_reviews.title: Good little TV
customer_reviews.text: First unit arrived DOA and without a manual. Amazon quickly refunded my money and I reordered it. The second unit works great! Several accessories come with it, including a pull up antenna, a short cable to hook to a antenna cable, a separate pull-up antenna with magnet, an AC cable, and a 12 volt cigarette plug. It will take a TiVo (that cable is also included). I ordered a gain antenna (August DTA240) which works better than any that come with the unit. Good picture quality and audio. Using it with my 12 volt supply in my amateur radio station. Well worth the money. One star off for the first unit arriving DOA.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Casey

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this small 7" LCD tv for roadies - don't need to break the bank for 12 volt
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a typical tv watcher in my sticks and bricks but when I'm on the road rving I do like to get up in the morning and listen to the news and weather wherever I am located. This tiny tv has a great, clear screen and is relatively loud. You don't have to pay a lot of money to have a 12volt tv on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Lias

customer_reviews.title: A great little TV
customer_reviews.text: A great little TV, nice picture, good sound, and lots of accessories. The only thing I would recomend is to buy a separete antennae. I bought a Mohu Leaf Metro, and now receive plenty of free HDTV channels. I use it in my semi when on break.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Krause

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on these type of TVs and found none had the battery life I wanted, and couldn't change batteries. It's no different with this model. I bought it as an emergency, power-outage back up but since the power drains even when it's not running and runs out in about 1.5 hours if it's fully charged, I have to say this is disappointing and won't adequately serve my purposes. I used to have a much heftier tiny TV that took 8 C-cell batteries that served me well until the industry switched to digital programming. This market needs a better, affordable option!
customer_reviews.author: JillJ550

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST tv of ALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok you people. I get about 7 GREAT channels... the quality is pretty good. The reason you aren't getting very great channel is because you most likely aren't in a good area for channels. But I still do recommend getting an amplifier or a 60 mi. or more channel antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Krysta H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost overall.
customer_reviews.text: Upside, I get 2 hour battery life. Downsides, 1) The 12V car adapter arrived broke. I had parts laying around to fix it. 2) it takes a very strong signal to watch anything. I bought an indoor/outdoor Amplified antenna to get any signals. The built in antenna and the included external antenna are useless for me. Picture quality is good and the audio is loud enough to use outdoors. The USB and SD card readers are easy to navigate on screen. Overall... worth what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis M. Burmeister

customer_reviews.title: Fragile, Low Battery Life, Poor Ability to Read TV Stations
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this TV to put in our tornado shelter. On receipt, one of the buttons was loose (rattling around inside the case). Once I'd charged it up fully, I scanned my local TV stations. It has a LOT of trouble actually receiving otherwise decent signal strength stations, even with the antenna fully extended. Battery life is promised as 2 hours. LIE. Mine lasts 5 minutes, at best. Amazon gave me a refund on my TV, so it's off to the trash can....GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: NICE IN APPEARANCE BUT MADE VERY CHEAPLY
customer_reviews.text: NICE IN APPEARANCE BUT MADE VERY CHEAPLY. customer_reviews.title: Not a good tv.
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased at all. This tv is cheaply encased in plastic. If you use it to capture over the air stations, scanning takes a long time to complete. The tv does not capture all the over the air channels that my other tv does even using the same antenna. The picture is dark. I really had high hopes for this tv, but I returned it. No hassles with the return.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gal

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: This tv was dead on arrival. It would not turn on. I followed the directions as carefully as I could and had two other people confirm that the tv was in fact not working. Amazon was nice enough to accept it back as a prepaid return. I just needed to print a shipping label and take it to a local ups store.
customer_reviews.author: mouse user

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold charge returned to Amazon 15+ days waiting for refund
customer_reviews.text: Please save yourself the headache of purchasing an item that could be defective and trying to return it to Amazon for a refund. The unit would not charge and therefore was inoperable. I scheduled a return within 24 hours of receiving the item. I confirmed Amazon has the defective item (for a week) and still not refund, it takes up to 15 days get a refund on your item, this was a credit card transaction. They do not value their consumers...I should have started my review with this statement.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this unit to replace an older model. first let me begin by saying it give you basic tv reception. my problems with this unit are as follows. 1. the antenna housing unit broke within a few hours of use. the antenna continually became loose and as a result of tightening the connection broke.2. the lack of a tv guide button on the unit. trying to see whats on or title is frustrating and infuriating at times.3. speaker volume is terrible. compared to my older unit the sound quality is bad but tolerable. overall i wouldn't recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: TRaymond

customer_reviews.title: Great small tv
customer_reviews.text: Works great, does everything that it was advertised to do

customer_reviews.title: Not Close Reeaching
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is awful, even close to a tower (3 miles) it wasn't great. I bought a Milanix it works almost as good as the house TV. I have over the air TV no cable or dish. The regular TV gets more stations . Th Milanix gets 13. My comparisons are apples to apples.

customer_reviews.title: Functionality Is Acutely Compromised
customer_reviews.text: This product is a "piece of junk.This thing will not hold a charge;inability to scan/pick up channels. The functionality of the remote is "acutely " compromised.

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of the TVs from this company and I'm satisfied with both
customer_reviews.text: Great tv outstanding picture for little tv with rabbit ears fantastic Also customer service is very nice the only problem I had was the DC plug to charge the little TV the tip was broken during shipment to me so customer service told me they send me another one still waiting I'll update you thank you Prime member Update Axess Customer service sent me the part for my 7 in tv Great service Thank you Prime member
customer_reviews.author: buddy nocerino

customer_reviews.title: Really nice picture and many channels.
customer_reviews.text: Appears cheap but surprisingly works well as I am near NY. Lots of air channels wand picture is excellent - battery life not great (up to a few hours) so plan to have one of those car battery starters with cigarette plug and you will be set if a big storm wipes your area out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Emergency T.V.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice emergency 7 inch T.V...Battery. life is questionable. You will also need an external antena to receive channels. This is used for power outages with an external battery pack. I have purchased 2 and given one away as a gift. Had mine for several years with no problems...for emergency uses I would recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Felix/ John Pytel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little TV for storm shelter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my storm shelter My storm shelter is in the garage not in the floor but a standing safe room. I did have to buy a better antenna, once I did the reception is great.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda  S Hood

customer_reviews.title: This is a good little portable TV
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little portable TV, with a "building" rechargeable battery( it can be left plugged in) to serve as emergency TV. I would recommend this one...

customer_reviews.title: Good color but...
customer_reviews.text: The TV looks well made. Lots of channels in my home area. Drawback is the remote. I had to be aimed perfectly at the sensor or the remote did not function. Also had to be close. A whole lot of remote buttons for a small device. Overall I would buy the set for my need which was hurricane power outage TV.
customer_reviews.author: TCharlie1

customer_reviews.title: Product Delivers As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Like: Purchased for Florida hurricane season. Functionality is good. Easy to set up. Dislike: Remote was difficult for my wife to press and activate the buttons. Seems you have to press firmly. Damaged 12V cord. Customer Service claims they are sending me a new one. TBD
customer_reviews.author: JD53

customer_reviews.title: Quality in a small inexpensive screen.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a tableside monitor for video security at our apartment complex over a year ago and it has never been turned off. Quality of screen and color are very acceptable when switched to cable tv. Have ever used on battery. Does all we need and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: Decent inexpensive small portable TV for use during power outage, or when traveling or camping to get local channels for weather reports, riot locations, ect. Picture is much better than my old b&w analog TV that no longer works!

customer_reviews.text: Scanned with several antennas and locations. Only picked up one station out of 5 or 6 available locally. Other OTA receivers in the house picked up all of the available stations.

customer_reviews.title: Works "ok"
customer_reviews.text: The one I got had a not so good tuner. I used their included adaptor cable to hook it up to the cable from our antenna and it only got a few of the channels that our existing TV gets. (19 vs 27)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: good for a few weeks, then garbage
customer_reviews.text: This little tv does a great job. I have only had for roughly a week now but haven't been disappointed yet. Battery holds about a hour or so charge. Long enough for emergencies. Has a car charger and aux cord as well. The picture is decent for what it is too. The biggest issue people will have is their location. If you live in a urban and populated area like me, maybe about 15 Channels. Including local CBS, NBC ABC and FOX affiliates. Update: 2 week Later. Item turned to garbage. power chord wouldnt work and tv kept flashing on and off. i sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: thejmjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate. Worked on AC adapter for a very short test period. After sitting for a year, plugged in again and now when on AC the unit goes on and off. Can charge battery and run off it but does not last very long. Super poor quality. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: JoePope

customer_reviews.title: like new". It came in the original package with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv "used, like new". It came in the original package with all the accessories except for the AC cable. It came with a lighter charger for the car and it worked well. It took almost 5 hrs to recharge the lithium battery BUT it only worked for 1 hr. The instructions that came with the tv don't explain how to set it up and I just figured out how to do it. It don't explain anything about the battery and how to recharge it. The picture looks great, the sound is kind of low.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen TV
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, I bought this small TV for my kitchen counter about 3 months ago. The picture quality is great, but the sound limitations are very disappointing. I have the sound at the loudest it will go, and can just barely hear it. If the microwave or dishwasher is running, I can't hear the TV program at all. If I had known then what I know now, I probably wouldn't have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Shimizu

customer_reviews.title: Portable TV
customer_reviews.text: It is now years later and my little TV is still like brand new. I use it for local OTA channels. Some reviews stated the speaker sounded tinny, but for the size they are clear and can put out a good volume, you also have the option of external speakers. I use a 'paper-size' ceiling antenna and it works great. Unless you're close to stations, the antenna is a must. I love my TV.

customer_reviews.title: Fine for UHF, not good for VHF
customer_reviews.text: Rarely do I do this..... overall a nice device, picture quality good enough for my (hurricane) planned use. The remote has zero ergonomic quality, just a bunch of buttons in a matrix, but not a big deal..... I returned this because it could not receive VHF (2-13) channels.... did fine with UFH (14-69).... that is with the provided antennas ......so I hooked it up to my long distance outside TV antenna (which works great for my normal TV viewing) with only limited success ..... so if you are looking for channels 2-13, not recommended.... if you only want channels 14-69 it should work well for you..... PS I did not check out the life of the battery

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice little tv

If it broke, I would buy another of the same.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny TV Comes in Handy
customer_reviews.text: After charging the battery, once I found the tiny on-off switch on the side it started right up. Very good picture and acceptable sound considering the small speakers. I got a lot more stations than my digital convertor could pick up. The fitting for the whip antenna is pretty flimsy, sometimes you have to hold it in tightly to get a good signal. It can also take a screw-on cable connection. You may need to move it around to pick up certain stations well. The remote control works nicely. I got it mainly as a small auxiliary TV to use in the kitchen or out on the deck. A great value for the money.
